title: TLS accesses aren't async-signal-safe

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
On many Unix platforms we install a [signal handler](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys/unix/stack_overflow.rs#L79-L121) for SIGSEGV/SIGBUS to catch stack overflow. This starts off by [accessing the thread-local stack guard](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys/unix/stack_overflow.rs#L105) which in turn will [access a `thread_local!`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys_common/thread_info.rs#L46-L48). Unfortunately, though, `thread_local!` is not async-signal-safe due to a number of reasons:

* The `with` function [can panic](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/thread/local.rs#L263-L264).
* We might [register destructors](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/thread/local.rs#L376) which [on some platforms](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys/unix/fast_thread_local.rs#L43) can [allocate](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys_common/thread_local.rs#L260).
* We can [allocate](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/thread/local.rs#L459-L462) on other code paths.
* We can [create other OS pthread keys](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/d84693b93dae3958e3504f817face0184c5c3fdd/src/libstd/sys_common/thread_local.rs#L157-L200) which I don't believe is an async-signal-safe function.

Unfortunately I don't really know the best way to solve this...
